data.title: Capturable husks for all mods
data.body: as this is an interesting game-play mechanic in Tiberium Wars and it also solves the problem of indestructible wrecks blocking vital cells. Tested it against bots (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/commit/1a33608b73602338663f7200c65fb12bdc2656c7 seems sufficient) and a second client on the same server (no desyncs).

data.body: They should make a big splash, not a explosion.

data.body: fixes #3877;

data.title: Map browser GUI element for allowBots
data.body:
When browsing for a map to play against bots, currently trial and error is needed: Select a map in the map browser, go back to the players screen and attempt to add a bot. Repeat if "no bots" is displayed.

I suggest either adding a filter to the map browser (drop down boxes to display only maps with the chosen attributes), or some kind of tag, text or icon on each map in the browser to display whether it supports bots.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1388784-map-browser-gui-element-for-allowbots?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: OpenRA.RunAfterDelay doesn't check for nil arguments
data.body: It will quite happily queue a null action, and cause a hard to debug NRE when the delay has expired.

data.title: Buff the Obelisk of Nod's health and damage
data.body: Add a buff to increase the obelisk of Nod's health from 400 to 600 - allowing it to be as durable as the advanced guard towers currently are - and their Damage from 200 to 360, making them equal to the AGT in base damage and about 25% more effective against tanks vs. the AGT's 288 in 96 ROF ticks.

data.title: cleanup map downloading
do not create empty map on fail to download
data.body: fixes #3877;

data.title: Helicopters continue bobbing while paused
data.body:

data.title: Tileset Builder Crash
data.body:
When i use "export" in the tileset builder, it always gives me an NRE:

System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at OpenRA.FileFormats.TileSet.Save(String filepath) in c:\Kanar\OpenRA.FileFormats\Map\TileSet.cs:line 117
   at OpenRA.TilesetBuilder.FormBuilder.Export(String outputDir) in c:\Kanar\OpenRA.TilesetBuilder\FormBuilder.cs:line 412
   at OpenRA.TilesetBuilder.FormBuilder.ExportClicked(Object sender, EventArgs e) in c:\Kanar\OpenRA.TilesetBuilder\FormBuilder.cs:line 238
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.RaiseEvent(Object key, EventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton.OnClick(EventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.HandleClick(EventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.HandleMouseUp(MouseEventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.FireEventInteractive(EventArgs e, ToolStripItemEventType met)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.FireEvent(EventArgs e, ToolStripItemEventType met)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.OnMouseUp(MouseEventArgs mea)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.WmMouseUp(Message& m, MouseButtons button, Int32 clicks)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlNativeWindow.OnMessage(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlNativeWindow.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.NativeWindow.Callback(IntPtr hWnd, Int32 msg, IntPtr wparam, IntPtr lparam)

What can I do about it?

The tileset builder 2 from the forums (dont know if that version is newer or older) seems to work fine, but also has issues.

I'm on Win 7.

data.title: Game freezes while playing - OS X crash
data.body:
My game regularly crashes after between 10 and 40 minutes of playing.

**At the time of this crash, I was playing against Red Alert against 3 AIs.** In all the crashes I have experienced, I don't remember doing anything special in the moment before the crash.

**I'm moving the cursor or clicking something, and then, suddenly, the screen freezes.** After a few seconds, (possibly only caused by me hitting Alt-Tab) the OSX beach ball appears.

In this last game, the one that generated the report below, there were a few laggy moments over the course of the game. All of those short lags lasted less than a second each. Then came the full freeze.

Happy to provide additional information if necessary :)

---

Red Alert Mod at Version release-20131223
Operating System: OSX (Unix 13.0.0.0)
Runtime Version: Mono 2.10.11 (mono-2-10/2baeee2 Wed Jan 16 16:40:16 EST 2013) CLR 2.0.50727.1433
Exception of type `System.IO.IOException`: Write failure
Inner Exception of type `System.Net.Sockets.SocketException`: The socket has been shut down
    at System.Net.Sockets.Socket.Send (System.Byte[] buf, Int32 offset, Int32 size, SocketFlags flags) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.Net.Sockets.NetworkStream.Write (System.Byte[] buffer, Int32 offset, Int32 size) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.Net.Sockets.NetworkStream.Write (System.Byte[] buffer, Int32 offset, Int32 size) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.IO.MemoryStream.WriteTo (System.IO.Stream stream) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Network.NetworkConnection.Send (System.Byte[] packet) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Network.EchoConnection.Send (Int32 frame, System.Collections.Generic.List`1 orders) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Network.ReplayRecorderConnection.Send (Int32 frame, System.Collections.Generic.List`1 orders) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.Tick () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.TickInner (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Tick (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Run () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

data.title: Missing ore mine graphics for interior tileset
data.body: Every tileset has mine.suffix like mine.tem for temperat. The current mine.shp is actually a crate powerup animation. However because it accidentally has the same name we have it as a backfall. It is a little weird seeing ore seeding from a sea mine icon. This is even stranger than the effect that ore is growing in an underground bunker from a vertical mineshaft.

data.body: Followup of #4399

data.title: '--docs' and and some other Utility commands don't work on Windows
Cycle units, buildings with mousewheel
data.body:
Couldn't the mousewheel be used to cycle factories, units... ?? 

For example, I select a tank, then I mousewheel and the viewport moves to the next same kind of unit (tank). Same for buildings : I select a factory, I mousewheel, then I can view the next one.

It would be a quick may to jump to another location, faster than scrolling the screen on the edges.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

data.title: Added an in-game map editor
data.body: I polished my ingame-map-editor branch for #3377 to allow the workflow of creating a blank new map, editing the terrain tiles and saving the map. Next is actor placement (at least spawn-/waypoints) and modifying the resource layer.

data.title: Add "passworded" filter for game list?
data.body:
Sometimes i join in games which require passwords. That is annoying when i dont know the game was going to need a password. And if there are going to be more than 1 such games, i would have to click through all of them blindly.

It would be a lot better if i could hide all the passworded games, until i need to join one later.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1384929-add-passworded-filter-for-game-list?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add web link in OpenRA folder?
data.body:
When the new version came a while ago, I didnt realise it until a week later, i simply thought nobody was playing.

I would suggest to add "check for updates" button to the main window (mod independant).

Also, there should be a link to this project in the OpenRA folder. Now i have to google this project page every time instead.

I just launched this game from other computer with old version, and I noticed some korean guy is waiting for players alone there; he probably doesnt know either that a new version came.

I think the mystery of playerbase decrease is somehow linked to this issue too.

data.title: Lua: Add Team.Patrol
data.body:
We should add a wrapper to make a team attack-move around a series of waypoints.
The following code (for a single actor) could be used as a starting point

``` lua
LoopPatrol = function(actor, waypoints)
   Utils.Do(waypoints, function(waypoint)
      Actor.AttackMove(actor, waypoint.Location)
   end)
   Actor.CallFunc(actor, function() LoopPatrol(actor, waypoints) end)
end
```

data.title: Lua: Add symbolic constants for facings
data.body:
We should expose symbolic constants for the 8 main facings for use in actor definitions:
This would simplify definitions like `local foo = Actor.Create(myActor, { Owner = foo, Location = bar, CenterPosition = baz, Facing = Actor.Facings.NorthEast })`

data.title: Setup sides, factions, colors, map options and actor properties (facing, health, stance?) in map editor.
data.body:
Scripting missions for OpenRA mods is very difficult right now. One way to make it easier would be to allow player setup in the map editor. I propose:
- ability to add/remove players/factions
- setup, lock / unlock factions and colors
- setup default map options like map type (conquest, campaign, etc), fog, shroud, crates, etc
-  setup Actor properties and behaviour (facing, health, stance).

data.title: Setup sides, factions, colors, map options and actor properties (facing, health, stance?) in map editor.
data.body:
Scripting missions for OpenRA mods is very difficult right now. One way to make it easier would be to allow player setup in the map editor. I propose:
- ability to add/remove players/factions
- setup, lock / unlock factions and colors
- setup default map options like mission/map type (conquest, campaign, etc), fog, shroud, crates, etc
-  setup Actor properties and behaviour (facing, health, stance) - right click menu maybe?
